  • Method Details

    • addProductSearchFieldClicked

      public void addProductSearchFieldClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method controls the search text field. This method allows the user to search for a part by id or name. Searches aren't case-sensitive. The user is able to do partial searches, meaning they don't have to enter the full name of a part.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - search product by name or id.

    • addProductSearchBarClicked

      public void addProductSearchBarClicked(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent keyEvent)
      This method sets the parts table to display all parts when the search field is empty.
      Parameters:
      keyEvent - key event

    • addProductSaveButtonClicked

      public void addProductSaveButtonClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method handles the save button. This method adds the new product to the inventory. If the addition is done successfully, then it takes the user back to the main form. This method will display alert messages if any text field is empty or contains invalid values.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - RUNTIME ERROR: the function saved the wrong info for max and min, the value saved for max was switched with min and vice verse. This was because I had the max and min text fields in the wrong places, so I switched the text fields and the info was saved correctly.

    • addProductCancelButtonClicked

      public void addProductCancelButtonClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      this method handles the cancel button.It does not save the input data and takes the user back to main screen. the method shows a confirmation message and takes the user back to the main screen if confirmed.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - cancel button clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException - IOException

    • addProductAddButtonClicked

      public void addProductAddButtonClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method handles the add button. This method adds parts to the bottom associated parts table from a selection on the top table.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - add button clicked.

    • addProductDeletePartButtonClicked

      public void addProductDeletePartButtonClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method handles the delete button. It removes a part from the associated parts table. This method shows a confirmation message before deleting the selected part.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - delete button clicked.
